content: ribbed bonnet pattern by @threadofkindeness_ intro hi my name is natalka and this is my first pattern so please be gentle with me if there are any mistakes dm me on my instagram i will try to help with anything you don t understand the bonnet is adult size it is stretchy so it should fit both bigger and smaller heads i would be extremely grateful for any feedback left in the comments or dms please don t sell the pattern neither any items you make using it respect that i spent a lot of time writing it and i m giving it away for free i would be grateful if you tagged me in social media posts featuring the bonnets instagram & tiktok @threadofkindness_ now grab your needles and enjoy the pattern what you need to know 3x3 rib 1x1 rib picking up stitches you can find video tutorials linked in the highlight on my instagram materials 5mm and 4 5 mm circular needles 60 cm or shorter approx 150 metres of any aran / worsted weight yarn 1 stitch holder / safety pin yarn i used / gauge 2 skeins 100 g of rowan frost gauge swatch 10 x 10 cm stockinette on 5mm needles = 20 stitches x 26 row as i said you can use any aran/worsted weight yarn cast on 21 stitches start working with 3x3 rib that means repeating 3 knit stitches and 3 purls stitches until the end of the row if you started the first row with knit stitches start the next row with purls continue until your work is 13 cm long cut the yarn but don t bind off the side of your work which has 4 knitted columns is the right side pick up 24 stitches along the right vertical edge starting in the bottom right corner on the right side of your work pick up three stitches out of every 4 stitches work through the stitches that are on your left needles as usual using 3x3 rib and pick up 24 stitches along the left vertical edge in the same way as before you should now have 69 stitches on your needles now work with 3x3 rib start the first row with purls continue until the hood is approximately 19 cm long change your needles to 4 5 mm now start working with 1x1 rib that means 1 knit 1 purl repeated until the end of the row the next row has to be started with purl continue until the ribbing is approximately 3 5 cm long and cast off change your needles back to 5 mm and pick up the stitches around the vertical edge face hole use the same method as before- pick up 3 out of every 4 stitches start working with 1x 1 rib and continue until the ribbing is 3 cm long knit the first 6 stitches cast off the rest except the last 6 secure the last 6 stitches with a stitch
